result.execSummary:
The defendant Julia Levia Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12/04/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes:
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Court found Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable. Any amout remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
- Restitution set at zero.
- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling, department to determined which is appropriate.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- NO CONTACT with the victim.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.
- Continue to work with the Benedict Center to complete GED, parenting class, and any other programs deemed appropriate.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant taken into custody on an absconder warrant.  No committment order was submitted to the court.  rmm

Statements made as to sentencing.  The Court ordered the following:

Defendant sentenced to serve 90 days in the House of Correction with credit for 64 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 YEAR.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management counseling, department to determine which is appropriate.
-Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-NO CONTACT with the victim.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges of this case, including any applicable mandatory surcharges and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Court found the Domestic Abuse surcharge is applicable.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  (Restitution set at zero)
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No firearms; weapons.
-Continue to work with the Benedict Center to complete GED, parenting class, and any other programs deemed appropriate.

Court advised defendant due to this DV conviction she may never possess firearms or ammunition.  

Case adjourned to Branch 40 for probation review.

Filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit
Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief
Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.

Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of her Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.

Defendant Julia Levia Scott in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Julia Levia Scott in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 40.  Case in court for jury trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.    Pursuant to negotiations, Count 2 is DISMISSED BUT READ IN for the purpose of sentencing.  Count 1- On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Disorderly Conduct, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 947.01(1) and 973.055(1), a Class B Misdemeanor.  Review hearing scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Julia Levia Scott not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 8/31/15 in Branch 40.  Defense may be filing a McMorris motion.
Pretrial Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.
SAME CONDTIONS TO APPLY.  ABSOLUTELY NO CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM.  Defendant must provided a verified different address to Justice Point.

Attorney Gabriela A Leija in court, defendant Julia Levia Scott not in court, in custody.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
JUDGE BOROWSKI FOR JUDGE DALLET.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.  Bail $250.00 cash  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription or no dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with J. R. (9/24/42).
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Julia Levia Scott in court with attorney Gabriela A Leija.  Defendant Julia Levia Scott in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
